intro: Ophiorrhiza shendurunii, commonly known as Shendurunii forest vine, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is a climbing shrub characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, berry-like fruits. It is native to the Western Ghats of India and thrives in moist, shaded forest environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
